articles.title: About this site
articles.description: Some additional details about the website

articles.title: Distibution comparison
articles.description: The exposure time variable, representing the duration the camera sensor is active to capture images triggered by animal movement or heat, is vital for assessing the quality and quantity of data from camera traps in wildlife research. This page utilizes the exposure time variable to illustrate the distribution of animals through bar plots, aiding in comparisons of wild animals captured by camera traps.
articles.contents:
Oribi is the most exposed animal



Visualizing wild animals camera trap Exposed time by diet



Comparing exposure Time of the Afican Big five wild animals
Elephant and Buffalo (Herbivorous animals)



Lion vs Leopard (Canivorous animals)



Hippopotamus vs Elephant (Herbivorous animals)

articles.title: Christmore Setebe
articles.contents:
Wildlife camera trap data visualization
          
          
          Home
          Distribution
          Relationships
          Time-series
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Christmore Setebe
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                        GitHub
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        Email
                      
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            As a wildlife manager and data analyst, I am passionate
            about leveraging data to uncover compelling insights that
            enhance wildlife conservation efforts. In this project, I
            will analyze and visualize Liwale WMA census data from 2018
            and 2019 to demonstrate how data-driven approaches can tell
            intuitive and impactful stories about wildlife. My objective
            is to illustrate the power of data analysis and
            visualization in informing conservation strategies,
            promoting sustainable wildlife management, and fostering a
            deeper understanding of wildlife dynamics.
            Make sure you click the top tool bars and scroll down and
            up in order to navigate to all visualizations pages
            I HOPE YOU ENJOY THE VENTURE
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Christmore Setebe
            
            
              
                
                                    
                    
                      GitHub
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      Email
                    
                  
                                  
              
            
            
              As a wildlife manager and data analyst, I am passionate
              about leveraging data to uncover compelling insights that
              enhance wildlife conservation efforts. In this project, I
              will analyze and visualize Liwale WMA census data from
              2018 and 2019 to demonstrate how data-driven approaches
              can tell intuitive and impactful stories about wildlife.
              My objective is to illustrate the power of data analysis
              and visualization in informing conservation strategies,
              promoting sustainable wildlife management, and fostering a
              deeper understanding of wildlife dynamics.
              Make sure you click the top tool bars and scroll down
              and up in order to navigate to all visualizations
              pages
              I HOPE YOU ENJOY THE VENTURE

articles.title: Comparing relationships
articles.description: The exposure time variable, which denotes how long the camera sensor remains active to capture images triggered by animal movement or heat signatures, is crucial in determining the quality and quantity of data collected by camera traps in wildlife research. This page uses the exposure time variable to showcase the relationship of animals through scatter plots, facilitating comparisons of the distribution of wild animals captured by camera traps.
articles.contents:
Visualizing Relationship of all species using exposure time variable
The goal is to compare the camera-captured appearances of all species, irrespective of their feeding behaviors, to explore their relationships.



Visualizing Relationship of animals with the same diet using Original-date variable
Original date variable this variable indicate the exact date the picture was captured by the camera trap
Leopard vs Lion (Both canivorous)
The objective is to compare camera-captured appearances to investigate species’ feeding behavior patterns.



Elephant vs Buffalo (Both herbivorous)
The objective is to compare camera-captured appearances to investigate species’ behavior patterns.



Hippopotamus vs Lion (Herbivorous vs canivorous)
The focus here is on comparing the appearance captured by the camera to explore the relationship between species’ nocturnal feeding behaviors.
